newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn, soy up slightly, wheat flat.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn, soy up slightly, wheat flat.

text.p: FOB Gulf corn and soybean basis values were slightly firmer as farmer selling remained slow and wheat prices were unchanged in quiet conditions, export sources said.

"Everybody is watching the harvest now," a broker said. "I think we're expecting some good harvesting weather. The better the weather is, the better the (grain) quality, and the easier it is to store."
Several brokers noted farmer selling was light this year as producers held out for higher prices. Cheap, abundant storage space also encouraged farmers to store grain.
Export business was said to be quiet after last week's active market. USDA reported on Friday record numbers of U.S. soybeans exported. Corn and wheat export figures were also strong, brokers noted.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Note: Z=CBOT December, H=CBOT March, nc=no comparison.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
Oct25-Nov15 unq unc unq + X unc
